verbose_text: As SLCO2A1 / MAC activity is modulated by a large number of pain initiating and pro inflammatory stimuli (e.g., cell damage, ligands of GPCRs, prostaglandins, etc.) and given its involvement in purinergic signaling, these channels may be of relevance in peripheral pain mechanisms.
evidence: MAC activity is modulated by a large number of pain-initiating and pro-inflammatory stimuli (e.g., cell damage, ligands of GPCRs, prostaglandins
